section.title: Why, When XPontus?
section.para: 2 years ago i was looking for a free XML Editor. I discovered Oxygen XML Editor(http://oxygenxml.com) which wasn't that popular and liked it.
I decided to create a free XML editor for my daily work as i work a lot with XML related technologies.

section.title: The programming language choice
section.para: I decided to use Java because it is cross-platform. I also work as a programmer analyst and java is the primary development language.
It could have been written in any object oriented language easily. As i use linux a lot, .Net didn't really cross my mind...

section.title: How i decided to design XPontus XML Editor architecture ...
section.para: I needed to use a kind of MVC architecture to maintain easily the application. I decided to create my own mini-object-container which configure actions, toolbar and the menubar from a XML file.
I followed some patterns such as singleton pattern, observer pattern,etc.
I am using Netbeans to code most of the gui because it doesn't really affect the code performance. When i first started i was using a kind of notepad but it was taking me too much time to type :-)
Syntax highlighting in java is a real pain for one man, believe it, so i used the modified jedit syntax package from bluej.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: We can define XSLT scenarios as XSLT transformations
The user defines the following data :

itemizedlist.listitem: an XSLT stylesheet which will be used to transform the XML file and optionnaly some parameters
the type of result expected (svg, html, pdf, text, xml)
the output file to store the result

section.title: Adding a XSLT Scenario
section.para:
You can add/edit/remove a XSLT scenario by using the menu Tools Manage XSLT scenarios
.

section.title: Executing a XSLT scenario
section.para:
You can perform a XSLT scenario by using the menu Tools Execute XML scenario XML
.

chapter.title: DTD Generation
chapter.para: You can generate a DTD from an XML document using the menu Tools Generate DTD .

section.title: What is a schema?
section.para: You can see a schema(ie. a schema in general) as a set of rules which define the structure of an XML document. You can find more information about XML Schema at http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-1/

section.title: What kind of external schema can you use?
section.para: You can validate XML documents against several kinds of XML schemata. XPontus supports RELAX NG, RELAX Namespace, RELAX Core, TREX, XML DTDs, and a subset of XML Schema Part 1.

section.title: Validating against external schema
section.para:
You can convert HTML files to XHTML transitionnal using the tidy option in the menu Tools Validate against external schema
.

section.title: Introduction
section.para:
You can convert HTML files to XHTML transitionnal using the tidy option in the menu Format Tidy HTML
.

section.title: About the Tidy HTML option
section.para: The Tidy HTML option uses JTidy, a java implementation of the Tidy tool from the W3C.

section.title: Single file validation
section.para:
You have to open the file you want to validate and use the menu Tools Validate XML
.

section.title: Using Batch Validation
section.para: You can validate a batch of XML files(and or directories) using XML Batch Validation.
The menu is Tools XML Batch Validation .
By default, the Batch Validation will be performed on file which filenames end by ".xml". You can choose to add or remove file patterns(*.svg,*.xsl,etc.)
If the option Look into sub-directories is selected, all the subdirectories will be scanned according to the XML patterns(file extensions) you specified.
